t: Psalm 103
Bless the Lord, O My Soul
Of David.
Bless*pn the Lord,*s O my soul, and*ld all that is within me, bless*ld his holy name!
Bless*ln the Lord,*s O my soul, and*ld forget not all his benefits,
who*ln forgives all your iniquity, who*ld heals all your diseases,
who*ln redeems your life from the pit, who*ld crowns you with steadfast love and mercy,
who*ln satisfies you with good so*ld that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
The*pn Lord*s works righteousness and*ld justice for all who are oppressed.
He*ln made known his ways to Moses, his*ld acts to the people of Israel.
The*ln Lord*s is merciful and gracious, slow*ld to anger and abounding in steadfast love.
He*ln will not always chide, nor*ld will he keep his anger forever.
He*ln does not deal with us according to our sins, nor*ld repay us according to our iniquities.
For*ln as high as the heavens are above the earth, so*ld great is his steadfast love toward those who fear him;
as*ln far as the east is from the west, so*ld far does he remove our transgressions from us.
As*ln a father shows compassion to his children, so*ld the Lord*s shows compassion to those who fear him.
For*ln he knows our frame; he*ld remembers that we are dust.
As*pn for man, his days are like grass; he*ld flourishes like a flower of the field;
for*ln the wind passes over it, and it is gone, and*ld its place knows it no more.
But*ln the steadfast love of the Lord*s is from everlasting to everlasting on those who fear him, and*ld his righteousness to children’s children,
to*ln those who keep his covenant and*ld remember to do his commandments.
The*ln Lord*s has established his throne in the heavens, and*ld his kingdom rules over all.
Bless*pn the Lord,*s O you his angels, you*ld mighty ones who do his word, obeying*ld the voice of his word!
Bless*ln the Lord,*s all his hosts, his*ld ministers, who do his will!
Bless*ln the Lord,*s all his works, in*ld all places of his dominion. Bless*ln the Lord,*s O my soul!
